<<<<<<< HEAD
A comfortable and heauenly inquisition not made by the vnmercifull Pope, Christs pretended vicar: but by our mercifull God, in Christ, our assured louing father. Or a sermon preached at the funeralls of the vertuous and religious gentlewoman Mris. Neale of Homersfield in Suffolke. Day, Valentine, b. 1589 or 90.
[6], 70 p.
Printed [by E. Griffin] for Nathaniel Butter, London : 1618.
Dedication signed: Valentine Day. Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: Gods inquisition after man. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======

Printed [by E. Griffin] for Nathaniel Butter, London : 1618.
Dedication signed: Valentine Day. Printer's name from STC. Running title reads: Gods inquisition after man. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
